image.altText: A young woman with pink dies hair.

props.synopsis: Kiesha Thompson, 23, had just dropped her daughter at daycare when she was hit, and died in hospital that night.

title.children: Police allege man charged with murder helped plot alleged hit-and-run of former partner with girlfriend

image.altText: A woman in a nurses uniform places flowers by a roadside tribute.

props.synopsis: The boy, who cannot be named, was due to appear in person in court on Tuesday morning, but refused to travel to Brisbane from the detention centre.

title.children: Teen admits to driving stolen car and causing triple-fatal crash north of Brisbane

image.altText: Young person using laptop computer in home setting.

props.synopsis: While the jobless rate has been slowly creeping higher, alarm bells are ringing about the potential for a big surge in unemployment as recruiters report seeing hundreds of applications for a single job.

title.children: ANZ warns unemployment could rise above 5pc as 'over-qualified' job applicants feel 'abandoned by society'

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris's campaign says she has secured the support of enough Democratic delegates to become her party's nominee. So how could her campaign against Donald Trump shape up?

title.children: Trump is pouncing on Harris's perceived weaknesses. Here's how her campaign could turn them into strengths

image.altText: A Windows PC shwing a "Blue Screen of Death" error.

props.synopsis: For much of the world, the CrowdStrike outage meant grounded flights and closed supermarkets. But many parts of Asia did not have the same society-wide consequences of the software update gone wrong.

title.children: China got through the CrowdStrike meltdown virtually unscathed. Here's why

image.altText: AWE Casino platform in Victoria's Otway Basin

props.synopsis: The federal government opens waters off the Victorian, Tasmanian and South Australian coasts for new gas exploration as it seeks to increase Australia's supply.

title.children: Waters off SA, Victoria and Tasmania opened for new gas exploration

image.altText: Two officers put a man in a grey jumper and black pants into the back of a police car.

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police charge an Arncliffe man with one count of trafficking children and claim to have removed at least seven potential victims from sexual exploitation following a 20-month investigation into an alleged criminal syndicate operating between Australia and Indonesia.

title.children: AFP investigation culminates in arrest of man behind alleged sex-trafficking operation

image.altText: A still from The Sloth Lane, showing an animated character smiling.

props.synopsis: "Creative hurricanes" Kristen Souvlis and Nadine Bates might be Queensland's best-kept secret, with the duo raking in awards for their popular kids' movies.

title.children: Can't get enough of Bluey? These Queensland animators are giving the popular Heeler family a run for their money

image.altText: Peter Dutton ai dance video TikTok

props.synopsis: Just hours after the Queensland premier described a fake video of him dancing as a "turning point" for democracy, a video surfaced of his federal colleagues using the same tactics.

title.children: Labor used AI video to mock Dutton's nuclear plan

image.altText: Caitlin raises her fist in the air when celebrating.

props.synopsis: The Matildas have finished fourth in the last Olympics and the last football World Cup. Caitlin Foord believes it has the team primed for a tilt at Parisian Olympic glory.

title.children: The Matildas are haunted by heartbreak. Caitlin Foord says it has them primed for the Olympics

image.altText: A close-up portrait photograph of Katrina Chivell.

props.synopsis: National Disability Insurance Scheme provider Katrina Chivell denies any wrongdoing, after allegations from a former client and two former workers that she overcharged the NDIS by roughly $300,000.

title.children: Just how easy is it to get paid by the NDIS for services not provided? Here's how one provider allegedly overcharged

image.altText: Mounds of red dirt overturned with two forensic officers and a digger and machinery in the background

props.synopsis: Forensic testing is being carried out on human remains found on the outskirts of Camooweal, a small township 190 kilometres north-west of Mount Isa, with police believing they belong to the one person.

title.children: Police search for identity of human remains found buried in outback Queensland

image.altText: A young woman in a multicoloured jumper looks off camera

props.synopsis: The detective who led the investigation into the 19-year-old's disappearance has told a murder trial the operation was hampered by various factors including listening devices in the accused killer's home and car being installed incorrectly.

title.children: 'Distorted' audio from incorrectly installed bugs hampered Amber Haigh investigation, murder trial hears

image.altText: A sunset over a beach with people lounging on the shore

props.synopsis: Authorities arrest an American man over the fatal stabbing of a Perth man during a holiday to Thailand.

title.children: Perth man fatally stabbed on Thailand beach, US man charged

image.altText: a black and blotchy graphic of Kamala Harris in front of an illuminati pyramid

props.synopsis: Only minutes after US Vice-President Kamala Harris announced she would run for president, deeply offensive false narratives about her began to resurface.

title.children: These are the major false narratives that will try to convince Americans Kamala Harris isn't fit for office

image.altText: Two boys smiling at their dad as the dad embraces his wife with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: Stella Assange shares the first photo of the WikiLeaks founder and their children since his release from a British jail last month.

title.children: Julian Assange's wife shares first family photo since husband's release from prison

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: Australia has done exceptionally well riding the boom in the Chinese economy. But the political and economic uncertainty surrounding the world's two biggest economies — the US and China — points to tougher times ahead.

title.children: While all eyes are on Washington, Beijing is quietly heading into economic oblivion

image.altText: A student with a big backpack waits for a bus on a dirt road

props.synopsis: With their counterparts' hourly rate rising to $35, Queensland school bus drivers won't receive a cent from an industry-wide wage increase which was designed to equalise pay in the sector.

title.children: Same job, different pay as school bus drivers excluded from government wage increases

image.altText: Man in blue coat walking behind man in tan coat and scarf with stone building behind them.

props.synopsis: After seven days of evidence, a hearing into assault and emotional abuse or intimidation charges against a Tasmanian Supreme Court judge has ended. Now the visiting Victorian magistrate will consider further written submissions before handing down her decision.

title.children: Hearing into judge assault charge concludes with friends raising alleged victim's alcohol use

image.altText: An officer leans against an ambulance with a kayak in the foreground

props.synopsis: A 3-metre white shark is believed to have inflicted a bite on a 23-year-old man who was found by an off-duty police officer.

title.children: Off-duty police officer uses dog lead to help save life of surfer attacked by shark in northern NSW

image.altText: A man in a chequered shirt stands in a garden looking solemn.

props.synopsis: The LGBTQIA+ community reacts with anger after police said two men had allegedly been lured via the dating app Grindr and assaulted.

title.children: 'It's not going away': LGBTQIA+ advocates react with anger after alleged homophobic attacks in Canberra

image.altText: A composite image of Mary Fowler, Lauren Jackson and Charlotte Caslick.

props.synopsis: Ten teams across six sports will represent Australia at the Paris Olympic Games, and many of them have genuine hopes of taking a medal home with them.

title.children: From the Matildas to the Gangurrus — everything you need to know about the Aussie teams bidding for gold in Paris

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a tree

props.synopsis: Police are investigating potential links between four robberies in which some residents were allegedly threatened in their homes with weapons.

title.children: Alice Springs resident says she was threatened with machete after running to help neighbour

image.altText: The corporate logo of Google Chrome reproduced on a white wall.

props.synopsis: After years of back and forth, the maker of the Chrome browser decides not to scrap third-party cookies.

title.children: Google has decided not to scrap third-party cookies. What are they and what does it mean for users?

image.altText: Construction at a school in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: The continued exhumation of a former cemetery on the grounds of a prestigious Hobart boys' school has uncovered an additional 1,300 human remains — with around 500 more bodies yet to be found.

title.children: Human remains found during excavation for new Hobart school building now top 1,300

image.altText: A half standing packing shed blown down by a storm

props.synopsis: A severe thunderstorm, described by locals as like a "tornado", leaves a trail of destruction across Roleystone in Perth's south-east after hitting in the middle of the night.

title.children: 'It's like an apocalypse': Perth hills residents shaken awake by violent winter storm

image.altText: Kamala Harris laughs on stage with a microphone in a blue blazer

props.synopsis: A lot has happened in US politics lately, so we don't blame you for not keeping up with the memes. Here's your guide to the biggest references surrounding Kamala Harris, starting with that infamous coconut tree.

title.children: Explaining the biggest Kamala Harris memes, from coconut trees to 'Momala' and Veep

image.altText: Before and after imagery shows widespread damage to trees and buildings.

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery has revealed the extent of damage to the Gaza War Cemetery at Deir El Belah, which is mainly dedicated to fallen Allied personnel, including more than 250 Australians.

title.children: Australian war graves in historic Gaza cemetery feared damaged or destroyed following Israel's invasion

image.altText: BMW plug-in hybrid charger

props.synopsis: A tax benefit has allowed Australians to save tens of thousands of dollars when buying plug-in hybrid cars but the motor industry warns that is set to end next year and it could slow sales and undermine emissions reduction efforts.

title.children: Plug-in hybrid car sales have surged but an expiring tax discount could soon end the party

image.altText: woman smiles in the centre of a crowd in a pub

props.synopsis: A celebration of First Nations music wasn't going to be stopped by 150-kilometre-an-hour winds as punters packed out the Ceduna Hotel to be inspired by big-name artists.

title.children: Pub the hottest ticket in town after wild weather forces remote festival indoors

image.altText: Two female touch football players, in singlets and hats, smiling and embrace after winning a match

props.synopsis: Australia has asserted itself again as the benchmark in the world of touch football, claiming world cup glory in England.

title.children: Emus win 12 golds, one silver medal, to dominate touch football world cup

image.altText: A man touches a computer keyboard with his nose

props.synopsis: Adelaide's Omkar Palav has typed the alphabet with his nose in 20 seconds and 52 milliseconds, which, if verified, is a new Guinness World Record.

title.children: Forget the Olympics, this man may be the fastest to type the alphabet with his nose
